events.originalText: Norwegian chess grandmaster Magnus Carlsen (pictured) defeated India's Viswanathan Anand to become world chess champion.
events.subtitle: Magnus Carlsen
events.headline: Magnus Carlsen defeats Viswanathan Anand to become world chess champion

events.originalText: Toy Story, the first feature film created using only computer-generated imagery, was released in theaters in the United States.
events.subtitle: Toy Story
events.headline: Toy Story released as first computer-generated imagery feature film

events.originalText: The B-2 Spirit stealth bomber of the United States Air Force was first displayed in public at Air Force Plant 42 in Palmdale, California.
events.subtitle: Northrop Grumman B-2 Spirit
events.headline: B-2 Spirit stealth bomber displayed in public at Air Force Plant 42

events.originalText: Two television stations in Chicago had their broadcast signals hijacked with footage of an unknown person wearing a Max Headroom mask and costume.
events.subtitle: Max Headroom signal hijacking
events.headline: Chicago television stations hijacked with Max Headroom footage

events.originalText: Two days after the death of Francisco Franco, Juan Carlos I was declared King of Spain according to the law of succession promulgated by Franco.
events.subtitle: Francisco Franco
events.headline: Juan Carlos I declared King of Spain after Francisco Franco's death

events.originalText: In Britain's worst mountaineering tragedy, five teenage students and one of their leaders were found dead from exposure on the Cairngorm Plateau in the Scottish Highlands.
events.subtitle: Cairngorm Plateau disaster
events.headline: Five students found dead on Cairngorm Plateau in mountaineering tragedy

events.originalText: The Beatles released their eponymous double album, popularly known as the White Album.
events.subtitle: The Beatles
events.headline: The Beatles release eponymous double album, known as the White Album

events.originalText: The United Nations Security Council unanimously adopted Resolution 242 in the aftermath of the Six-Day War between Israel and Egypt, Jordan, and Syria.
events.subtitle: United Nations Security Council
events.headline: UN Security Council adopts Resolution 242 after Six-Day War

events.originalText: John F. Kennedy was assassinated by Lee Harvey Oswald in Dallas, Texas; hours later, Lyndon B. Johnson was sworn in aboard Air Force One as the 36th President of the United States.
events.subtitle: John F. Kennedy
events.headline: John F. Kennedy assassinated in Dallas, Lyndon B. Johnson sworn in as President

events.originalText: The crews of three Brazilian warships – all commissioned only months before – and several smaller vessels mutinied against perceived "slavery" being practised in the Brazilian Navy.
events.subtitle: South American dreadnought race
events.headline: Brazilian warships' crews mutiny against perceived slavery in Navy

events.originalText: The French steamship Ville du Havre collided with a Scottish iron clipper in the North Atlantic and sank with the loss of 226 lives.
events.subtitle: SS Ville du Havre
events.headline: French steamship Ville du Havre sinks in North Atlantic, 226 lives lost

events.originalText: The Geisel School of Medicine, the fourth oldest medical school in the United States, was founded by the physician Nathan Smith.
events.subtitle: Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth
events.headline: Geisel School of Medicine founded by physician Nathan Smith

events.originalText: The pirate Blackbeard (pictured) was killed in battle by a boarding party of British sailors off the coast of the Province of North Carolina.
events.subtitle: Blackbeard
events.headline: Pirate Blackbeard killed in battle off coast of North Carolina

events.originalText: Dutch colonial forces on Taiwan launched a three-month pacification campaign against the island's indigenous peoples.
events.subtitle: Dutch Formosa
events.headline: Dutch colonial forces launch pacification campaign against Taiwan's indigenous peoples

events.originalText: The Spanish explorer Juan Fernández discovered the islands off the coast of Chile which now bear his name.
events.subtitle: Juan Fernández (explorer)
events.headline: Juan Fernández discovers islands off coast of Chile, now named after him
